notesStmt.note: Verse endings denoted by a period, piyyuṭ endings by a sof pasuḳ; A. The recto opens with the last four verses verses (ק-ת) of the Ahavah קנה עשרייה המשולה במצבת, monorhymed כת-; B. The Zulat אמונים הישירו צעד, four verses per strophe, three alphabetic and the fourth from the theme, which is the Haftarah of this Sabbath, Isaiah LXI 10, and the other Haftarot of Consolation. This continues on the verso. This scheme and its alphabetic acrostic continues in the next two segments. Combined they form [א-ת שמוא[ל. Published by M. Zulay, Haaretz, April 21, 1950; C. The Mi Kamokhah שפות ארוכה ותעלה; D. The Adonai Malkenu שעבודי ארך וכבה זרחי (Davidson, TMHP 1087ל).
